intro: Cassia brasiliana var. tomentosa, commonly known as the silky cassia, is a shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces long, flat seed pods that contain numerous small, brown seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
